caption: The atmosphere was great, the food was delicious and the staff was accommodating. What became questionable was the $80 bill I gave a $35 tip towards. The waitress whole demeanor and attitude changed drastically and not for the best. Simply put...be grateful,that was generous ❣️
Vibe 10/10 pasta 10/10 - must try the gnocchi beets!
i m so in love with this place. its so cozy and special. best food in nyc. if you re ever in the city after this pandemic, this is the place of happiness and freedom.
This place is so unique. Words can not convey the experience I get here every time I come.
Charming place with great food and service. Ambiance in the garden is thrift store chic, but the food is top notch and elegant. Our waitress, Valeria, was super sweet and accommodating.

Wonderful restaurant with some of the best service I've experienced in Williamsburg.  The wine menu has a lot of great options.  Our server was able to offer us great recommendations and boy was it worth it!  The outdoor dining setup is perfect for date night or getting together with a small group.

Showed up with a party of 6. Excellent service and food. Everyone enjoyed their dish. I can’t say enough about the service - so very friendly and personable. Would definitely return. Highly recommended.
I've visited this restaurant a couple of times and their food and service are second to none. I totally recommend this place specially if you're craving for some delicious Italian food.
Just so everyone knows they only take American express, No other credit card & no cash. Didn’t tell us until we were finished with our meal.
Has a delightful covered area with a canopy of grape vines growing everywhere. Our server was very sweet, and gave us a bunch of grapes to try from the canopy after our meal.
Excelente place...Food is amazing and service is great!!!
This restaurant is so beautiful and the food is incredible!!. Our waitress was so lovely and attentive. If you are looking for a date night place, this is it!

What an experience. Absolutely the best Italian Spot in Williamsburg. The owner makes this restaurant the beauty it is. She made sure we had an experience that would stand out and your wine glass will remain full.
Great food , this place has a great atmosphere Friendly staff . You can order food to pick up . Excellent food

This place was absolutely LUMINOUS the decor the atmosphere The Food and Especially our host Valeria she was so great with my 3 yr old daughter , boyfriend and I. It was our 1 year Anniversary and what better place to celebrate between the Delicious  Wine Valeria suggested the candlelight Scrumptious dinner and treating my daughter with such grace,  Valeria went out of her way to keep my daughter happy and entertained especially now during Covid19 Valeria definitely made our night extremely special and I will never forget it Thank you!!! WE WILL DEFINITELY COME BACK !!
The greatest
Awesome Food, Great Service, Awesome Ambiance!!
Great ambiance amazing service delicious pasta.
The food was lovely and the staff were amazing! I proposed to my fiance at this restaurant and we're married now. Clearly, all the credit goes to the food.
I had an awesome time at this place. We enjoyed the first-rate atmosphere and the menu. The staff members are very amiable. I’m content we ultimately decided to try this restaurant.

Made a reservation for brunch one day as my friends and I were going to see another friend play a show at a blackbox nearby. Only influence was online reviews. It's an open-air sitch and on a hot, humid day it didn't make for a good experience. They had giant fans noisily and uselessly blowing air. And in that environment I can't imagine how awful it must be in the kitchen. My guess is miserable. The food tasted like it was made by a person that was not enjoying themselves. All that and it was pricey as hell too. It was a terrible feeling using their ATM to get cash for an experience that I really ended up regretting. And the amount of cash I had to get out really stung.
Waitress was Magnificant. Truly gave us an amazing time and food was also great. Great place for couples and dinners.
Celebrated my older brother bday party here and it was fantastic. Beautiful food, wine and atmosphere. I definitely plan on going back!
Their beets pasta is amazing 😉
Excellent food and staff.
Delicious food!

First of all the place was as beautiful as the pictures in google.  The service was outstanding and the food amazing.  My daughter got married there on November 8th, 2019 The server was such a pleasant young woman she took care of 16 people and always with a smile.  My guest couldn’t believe how authentic this restaurant is.  Felt as if I was in Tuscany😊.  I had the filet mignon and mashed potatoes it was delicious.  You will be seeing some of us again.  On behalf of my daughter Inez and husband Justin Thank you for making our special day even more special. God Bless.  Deborah
Perfect food and perfect service!
Great

This is the restaurant that you've always walked past but never tried, then realized one day how much you'd been missing. Service was remarkable and the food was excellent. Around our big group dinner there was a whole selection of pasta dishes and pizzas, as well as a lovely baked eggplant. Highly recommend for a meal with friends - the wine menu was fairly priced for the neighborhood, and the ambiance on the 7th Street side of the restaurant was truly romantic.

We’re from the UK and stopped here to have a drink, we left our bag here which contained our passports. We didn’t realise we had left it until the next morning. The restaurant staff went out of their way to find us and call us to let us know. We are so very grateful for their honesty and kindness! This is definitely a place to go, the staff go the extra mile. 😊 the next time we are in NYC we will definitely be back.
Bad service food nothing special

Hidden gem in the wilds of Williamsburg. This charming Italian spot appears to have been plucked from Cinque Terre or Amalfi. From dining in a romantic garden with vines growing up the walls, to lots of candlelight - and cuisine that is more reminiscent of Roma than Bedford Ave. Absolutely loved this place and cannot wait for a return!
Amazing indoor garden! You wouldnt believe you are in nyc! The pizzas are exquisit and the service is so good! Everyone is a charm
Very nice and relaxed Italian. A mix of traditional and Anglo-Italian. The servings are huge. Be prepared to take some home. Great staff and good wine selection too
Ok
(Translated by Google) Very good  (Original) Muy bueno

Excellent attention, the food very tasty excelente cook of the meet and all was very fast and good service, the waitress very respectful and explain everything about the food the wines and all about the orders! Excellent place to go back! Recommended!
One word: papardelle Bolognese. Ok that's two. Just get it.

(Translated by Google) Warm welcome, tasty starter, fast service, main dish of my girlfriend was nice. I personally didn't like mine. And had too much. Too bad you can only pay with American express or cash.  (Original) Warm ontvangt, lekker voorgerecht snelle bediening, hoofdschotel van mijn vriendin was wel lekker. Dat van mij vond ik persoonlijk niet lekker. En veel te veel gekregen. Jammer dat je enkel met american express kan betalen of wel cash.

Romantic setting for two, delicious smoke mozzarella, shrimp in brandy sauce and salmon were very good. Grape Vines growing around and hanging above the tables. Wrought iron furniture, simply charming.
Excellent food(Mario the owner chef is great ) , service can be great but not always ! Place is great
Amazing place. The food is some of the best Italian I've had in the city. Great service and beautiful setting. Highly recommend.

(Translated by Google) The pizza was good and well priced. The nice deal. The bathrooms a bit messy, but the space is lovely.  (Original) La pizza estaba buena y bien de precio. El trato agradable. Los baños un poco desarreglados, pero el espacio es encantador.

Food was good. But the state of the washrooms was unacceptable, dingy, loose faucet, toilet installed diagonally, and most criticaly, no soap. How are staff washing their hands properly? If they can't fix these highly visible issues I wonder what's going on behind the scenes.
Great pizza,  very good service.
Excellent food. Service amazing !! Had a great time with my family at this restaurant .
Very Italian feel. We toured back streets in Italy and this fit the bill. They make their own pasta on site.
This is a great place to host an intimate Brooklyn wedding. The staff is wonderful to work with as well. We look forward to filming more weddings here in the future!

(Translated by Google) There is a grape shelf on the ceiling so that the bright daytime atmosphere is very good. The food is also familiar and familiar to the Japanese. The staff worked hard to correspond to the Japanese.  (Original) 天井にはブドウ棚があります❗そのせいで店内明るく昼間の雰囲気はとても良いです。料理も日本人の口に合い馴染みやすいです。スタッフは日本人にあわせて頑張って対応して頂きました。

Great atmosphere, it feels like you’re outside and the “patio” is lovely. Oddly, they only accept Amex for credit cards, or cash. So come prepared! But the food was delicious and our server was very sweet!
Very good pizza for usa (go to italy and you know what i mean) cozy location, tip.
Great food! very friendly staff, wonderful decor

I love the place the minute I walked in. It's beautiful and the food it's incredible. The service is spectacular and always showing true care. They have a policy where you pay with Amex only but they also have an ATM on the spot :)
Had the special whole fish, which was magnificent. Ambiance is excellent and staff are nice.
Tasty pizzas with awesome price. Really calm during weekdays to lunch!

Overall a mediocre meal. I went to Acqua Santa several years ago and the quality of the food and service has gone downhill.  I ordered the sauteed squid, but a fried calamari appetizer was served instead. The squid ink pasta with seafood was acceptable. Not great quality seafood and several pieces of octopus were chewy and fatty. Even if it had been cooked perfectly, some aspects of service overshadowed the meal  There were several issues with service. The server brought out a bottle of opened wine, instead of opening it at the table - after mentioning it as one of the wines which they offer by the glass. The appetizer and entree arrived at the same time, and the service was generally inattentive.  I would not return for another meal. A disappointment.
Cute little spot with decent food and a nice ambiance
Lovely garden atmosphere - food is fine but not great - good price mark

This place has magic, feels like authentic, everything was amazing and foood yuuuummy, everything ok, except the moment when i had to pay the check, the server left me waiting 40 mins between order the check and take my money, the restaurant was empty, I’m a server too so I understand, when you are busy and lonely but this wasn’t the case, I’ll give 4 stars because this little things sometimes are not the restaurant fault
Great Italian food and amazing Pasta
Good place

This place has a lovely patio and a friendly staff, but the food is awful. The Caprese Salad was made of Shoprite-quality tomatoes and mozzarella, and had clearly been prepared earlier and then kept at too low a temp in the fridge. My fish was literally encrusted in a salt cake, and my girlfriend's gnocchi was drowned in a gelatinous Chef Boyardee-style goo. You can get much, much better food for the money in many nearby spots.

(Translated by Google) We are three friends who chose this place for dinner. It seemed nice at first, we were treated with kindness until the time to pay, apart from that the food was not nothing special for the prices they have. They brought the bill and we paid by leaving a tip but it did not seem enough and the waiter demanded more, arguing that he lived on that. We asked for an explanation and at that same moment another waitress appeared making violent gestures making us feel very uncomfortable. We accompanied this waiter to the exit with a bang. Very bad experience THE WORST!  (Original) Somos tres amigos que escogimos este sitio para cenar. Parecía bonito en un principio, nos atendieron con amabilidad hasta la hora de pagar, a parte de que la comida no era nada del otro mundo para los precios que tienen. Nos trajeron la cuenta y pagamos dejando propina pero no les pareció suficiente  y el camarero nos exigió más argumentando que el vivía de eso. Nosotros pedimos una explicación y en ese mismo momento apareció otra camarera haciendo gestos violentos haciéndonos sentir muy incómodos. Nos acompañó este camarero hasta la salida con un portazo. Muy mala experiencia. LA PEOR!
Beautiful Italian restaurant
Food is good. But only Amex card. Dont like it that much
Best gnocchi I've had in a while

It's rare that I leave a post this low, and I do feel bad about it given how personable and attentive our waitress was, but... The food and wine list leave a lot to be desired. From the front, it looks like a dollar slice shop, but the back of the restaurant is actually quite lovely.
Lovely Italian oasis to visit in the middle of winter! Some of the best pizza I’ve ever had and excellent service. Highly recommend sitting in the patio.
Amazing food, amazing staff, amazing atmosphere
I love this place. The red beet gnocchi is delicious and by far my favorite! The staff is very friendly and I'm obsessed with the decor of the dining area. 5 stars!
Outstanding service by valerie!
Delicious food, super fast service, nice stuff,  friendly atmosphere,  quite interesting exterior and design. Would recommend!

This place is pure fun! The best tip would be to be assertive because the servers move fast trying to cater to everyone with bringing the very delicious food! The vibe is homey and backyard Italian garden casual. Don’t forget to ask for bread!!! The action is in the back btw so don’t settle for the front bar area.
Quant little place, perfect for romantic dinner, excellent food

I had such a great experience at this restaurant! I went on recommendation of a friend and took family visiting Brooklyn for the night. All of the food was absolutely scrumptious but the house made bread and the fresh mozzarella really stood out. It's probably the best authentic Italian food I've ever had. I also enjoyed meeting the owner. He was such a jolly character and gave us complimentary shots of his house made Lemoncello - SO GOOD!
Food great! People supurb.

Amazing food, amazing atmosphere! This place pays more attention to detail than many fine dining restaurants twice the price. Hot dishes come on warm plates, cold dishes come on cold plates. This is a simple thing that most places skip because it's inconvenient, but it makes a huge difference. The wait staff was awesome, I couldn't be more impressed. Thank you for a wonderful night.
(Translated by Google) Personal recommendation: ask for calzone.-  (Original) Recomendación personal: pidan calzone.-

(Translated by Google) Very cozy restaurant !!! It was recommended to me by my guide, and the truth is the food is delicious !!! The pizzas are tasty and big, and the price is pretty good. If you compare them to restaurants in Manhattan. Very friendly and helpful staff !!!  (Original) Restaurante muy acogedor!!! Me lo recomendó mi guía, y la verdad la comida es deliciosa!!! Las pizzas son sabrosas y grandes, y el precio es bastante bueno. Si los comparas con restaurantes en Manhattan. El personal muy amable y atento!!!
Amazing place, super service
Great Italian place
Excellent food and outdoor atmosphere!!
Pasta was good although lacked flavour, was hoping for more as it was recommended.  The garden is a beautiful setting and ads ambiance.
Delicious food. Be aware that they only take AMEX
Great space. Delicious food. Fantastic service.
Food was amazing. Wait staff was on point. Definitely would go back.

Ordered the CALZONE DI STAGIONE, ordered this giant calzone stuffed with mozzarella, fresh tomatoes, prosciutto & rucola. It was served with a big salad, I had no idea it came with a salad. I ate it by myself but 2 people certainly can share this meal. By the way, tasted great. Should have taken a pic.
Relax place next to the city
Amazing Italian Restaurant right off the bedford av L Stop. Their interior decor is very green and inviting - rare find in the city! I recommend going when they have their $10 pizza specials.

Amazing food and beautiful interior! Ordered the Verdona pizza, a flavourful and fresh thin crust pizza perfect for two ($10 before 6pm!) - would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a bite in Williamsburg
The vines wrapping around this place are real and so are the hanging grapes! Sunday pizza special being $10 is worth coming back for.

Lovely Italian dining experience. I absolutely loved the inside of this place. The decor and the plants made me feel right at home. My boyfriend and I met the owner and he was very welcoming and friendly. We both enjoyed our pasta dish as well as the meat plate appetizer. I also loved the free bread that came with our meal. It was flavorful and crunchy on the outside. Their food is made fresh in house. I would like to add for future  diners that this restaurant only accepts cash as well as one type of card for now - American Express. They included a neat book of matches with our leftovers.
Lovely romantic spot. Excellent food and wine. Looking forward to coming back.
Great price to value in Williamsburg - great options.  Service could be better, but definitely fast and unpretentious.  Beautiful interior. Very European.
Surprisingly bad
Very friendly and nice place with really good pizza for a fair price! One of my food highlights on this NY trip.

(Translated by Google) Excellent service, food and atmosphere! Delicious and authentic Italian food, it's like traveling in one bite to Italy. Whenever I am in NY I will try to go back.  (Original) Excelente atención, comida y ambientación! Comida Italiana auténtica y deliciosa, es como viajar en un bocado a Italia. Siempre que esté en NY voy a intentar volver.
Some of the rudest service ever received in bk

(Translated by Google) The pasta was not the best, and the wine by the glass was only one choice. Except if you had to get a bottle. The first time I was satisfied. I speak of about six months ago. Has it changed management? Who knows !!!! !!!!  (Original) La pasta non era delle migliori, e il vino in bicchiere una sola scelta. Tranne se dovevi prendere una bottiglia . La prima volta sono rimasto soddisfatto . Parlo di circa sei mesi fa. E' cambiato gestione? Chi lo sa' !!!!😣
Love the atmosphere and authentic Italian food

Comfortable surroundings,  attentive service and delicious off beat authentic Italian cuisine at a fair price. Have been, and will be, back again----especially in the spring and summer for dinner under the grape vines.

Valentine's Day was perfect at Acqua Santa! Fixed price menu with flavorful Italian dishes ranging from Linguine al Pesto to Lamb Chops. Friendly service and splendid atmosphere.  Only criticism is that they accept AMEX and Cash only. First time I've been to a restaurant that accepts American Express and not Visa/Mastercard...odd. Despite the payment limitations, I still give 5-stars for the above reasons!
Very romantic setting. Good for dates. Food was good but nothing crazy. Would go back again.

(Translated by Google) Probably the cutest restaurant I have ever had. I ate well and the owner, very kind, offered me a glass of wine. You have to go if you are in Williamsburg!  (Original) Sans doute le restaurant le plus mignon que j’ai pu faire. J’ai bien mangé et le patron, très gentil, m’a offert un verre de vin. Il faut y aller si vous êtes à Williamsburg !

I went to Acqua Santa 3 years ago, in December 2014. My impressions of the place at the time weren't very good. Tonight, we were in the mood for Italian food, so I decided to give them another try, just in case they had a bad night back then.  I will say that the decor and atmosphere are very nice. Also, the staff seemed nice and eager to help. However, those are the only 2 good things I can say about the place.  Our table wasn't stable. The waiter noticed this and was very kind and gave us beer coasters to level it, but it'd be nice if they just fix their tables.  The bread wasn't great, the caprese  salad was ok.  We ordered 2 dishes of pasta. At first, only 1 came out- the Pappardelle Bolognese. The pasta was definitely under cooked- it was too hard and some of the pieces were sticking together. The sauce was bland and scarce. The portion was generous. Still, I'd expect more from an $18 pasta.  The second pasta dish (Spaghetti Puttanesca) only came out when I finished the Bolognese. The Puttanesca was too oily and didn't taste that great either.  The place only accepts American express. Otherwise, it's cash only.

(Translated by Google) I loved the pizza here! the excellent care and space of the garden. Very well located diagonally to the subway stop  (Original) me encantó la pizza de acá! la excelente atención y el espacio del jardín. Muy bien ubicada en diagonal a parada de subte
Loved it!
The waitress never showed up , so we just left after 20 min. P.S place was half empty, not busy at all.
Food was pretty good, nothing special though. Loved the vibe the half-outside seating had with all the plants.
Ambiance was unique and inviting.  Sitting outside while still the comforts of indoor dining.  The food was delicious, hand made pasta.
Absolutely amazing place.  Excellent food and incredible atmosphere.  Prices are right in line with the experience, not too expensive.

My husband and I shared both engagement and honeymoon meals in Acqua Santa and I have to say that both times were absolutely wonderful. The staff, the space, the food... so special. Hoping to visit again to celebrate many anniversaries!
Delicious pizza! Great atmosphere

Something unique, in terms of the decor; charming.  Very tasty Italian dishes and pizza. Lovely waitresses add to the comfortable atmosphere .  Have told my friends about this place and plan to celebrate my birthday there!

Wow!  Total gem, amazing interior garden space that delivers a very relaxed European setting and the music helps. I enjoyed just sitting and being there.  Simple menu, fresh (made in house that evening) pasta & pizza and classic European family style service. Relax, be patient, have some class, and enjoy the experience.  This isn't the greatest restaurant in Brooklyn, but it's a wonderful place to bring someone you love.
The food is very good. The decoration with grape vine and old fashioned furnitures is really unique.
Food is amazing and atmosphere is great for any occasion.

(Translated by Google) Good Italian food and the dining room located on the patio with a giant vine is very nice. Very correct service.  (Original) Buena comida italiana y el comedor ubicado en el patio con una parra gigante es muy agradable. Servicio muy correcto.

Had a party of 18 for my husband's birthday. Everything was amazing, especially service. Food was so fresh and delicious,  just looking at it makes your mouth water. Prices don't bite. And my favorite - the atmosphere.... oh, I can go on and on about how gorgeous the garden is.... if you have ever been to Italy you will feel like you are back in time. My new favorite place. 5 stars. Thank you ,Mario and staff
Food was great, but the best part was the sweetest most caring Italian woman serving us she was wonderful. Thank you for the great time

The three of us arrived about 1020pm last night. The place had only two other tables occupied. We ordered from our Polish waitress. It was her first day- sweet but obviously not very experienced in the restaurant business. The hostess or manager kept coming over and talking to us. We ordered a nice bottle wine and three simple pasta dishes.  Two were just ok and the other had little taste The waitress returned asking again for the bottle we ordered, we told her again at some point it was brought to us - very good one. The pastor arrived at about 10:45 PM. 10 minutes later not quite halfway through our meal we were told we have to leave in five minutes because they closed at 11. The hostess came and proceeded to talk to us for three minutes so I we just assumed we need to be too much in a rush to leave exactly at 11. Wow! Were we wrong! We were told at 10:57 we need to leave they were closing at 11 we had to leave by 11 we haven't finished reading wish I had a half a bottle of wine but we were told we had to leave. This is not McDonald's. This is a high priced restaurant. We all asked if they were joking. They said no they lock the door and we had to get out. And then we got the lecture on why they closed at 11 and why we had to leave. Very bad rude people.

First of all: best atmosphere and service ever! Beautiful garden, and rustic tables :) Food and wine were delish and with reasonable prices. Plus: is not so crowded as other overated places at Williamsburg. I had an octopus carpaccio (very fresh, but may be the wasabi sauce was a little bit strong for my taste), and a beautiful beet gnocci dish. Very fullfilling as well. Don't miss this place!
Good food.
Came here for brunch. Food was good and prices are reasonable. Would come back.
Nice place, great staff!
Best authentic Italian restaurant romantic in the back with flowers all around you
Delicious pizzas, gorgeous patio atmosphere !! Lovely waitstaff and super friendly ! 🤗
Most underrated restaurant in the triboro area!
I've been there twice and had absolutely amazing experience. Marking it as my favorite place and definitely will be back
Great place place with an amazing year round patio. Mario was our server and he made our large group feel like we were the most important guests ever. The food was amazing aswell.
Really good food and a great staff
My favourite spot at Bedford for food and drinks, great staff especially the owner Mariano
Italian nice food

(Translated by Google) I love everything in this place, the food is without a doubt spectacular and my recommended gnocchi !!  (Original) Amo cada cosa de este lugar , la comida sin duda alguna es espectacular y mis recomendados los ñoquis!!
Cannot describe how lovely this afternoon experience was. Atmosphere A+++ I don't know how anyone couldn't find this place to be absolutely anything but charming and perfect.

Very bad experience: bad service, food ok but nothing worth trying. We've been waiting one hour for our meal (yes, one hour). Definitely not worth it, although the patio looks attractive from outside. There are plenty of much better places in Williamsburg.
Terrible experience. Waited 1h to get one pizza...that was not tasty at all. I'd rather have a frozen pizza. Many better Pizza places in Williamsburg to go to.  Don't waste your time and money there.
Pretty garden area, pretty good food.

I was here a few weeks ago , the service was amazing and super friendly staff, food was served in a decent wait time, the only issue why I don't give 4 stars is the plants . Mosquitoes will suck you up during summer time because the open door and mixed plants don't mix . Otherwise a nice place to have a decent dinner.
Mediocre food, indifferent service, cash only. Not competitive given options nearby.
One of my top 10 spots to eat in NYC. You must visit Acqua Santa in the summer to eat in their lovely garden. Every wait person has an authentic Italian accent and their food is incredible.
The carbonara was rich and delicious. Note cash or American express only!

Some of the worst "Italian" food I've ever tasted.  Of course, I'm first generation and my Italian immigrant mother is an excellent cook, so I do have high standards.  However, I'd rather eat at a Sbarros than this place!

There is not much of anything to complain about great food, good service, beautiful ambience and all for a reasonable price. I'd recommend this restaurant with no hesitation, I have a few friends coming into town and guess where we will be dining. Hopefully I can catch the live music this time around, for the cherry on top!

Three years ago this place was great. It's obviously under new management however. Our terrible meal started with wine that had turned and ended with pasta so inedible it took me 5 minutes to swallow one bite. In an effort to not waste food, I tried giving my shrimp loving dog the shrimp and he flat out refused it also.  After seeing the wine and food was untouched, I was offered a doggy bag and the full bill. All of this I had simply chalked up to a terrible night out, but it all got so much worse once I posted a review explaining my experience on Facebook.  I woke up two mornings later to this exact response from the acqua santa, written at midnight the night before:  "Sorry you feel this way but the server asked you if everything was and your reply was affirmative. Now you make these unfortunate comments which lead me to believe that you and your dog are spoiled by can food, maybe you should stick to that."  When I shared this disgraceful with my friends and my husband also left a review, the restaurant disabled us from leaving comments on their page and threatened to sue my husband.  Needless to say, this restaurant is one to avoid at all costs, your stomach, wallet and dignity will thank you.
The pizza here is amazing!! The staff is always very friendly and attentive. I have eaten inside the restaurant area and at the bar, and both experiences were great!!

Amazing food! The Frutti Di Mare is one of the best I've ever had! Great dinner ambiance in the garden and good place to grab a beer and pizza in the bar. I'm a native New Yorker and have had my fair share of Italian food throughout the boroughs, and you're always in for a good meal at Aqua Santa.
The food was amazing. The service was great. This place never disappoints. Awesome place for a nice dinner with a friendly staff.

Service was ok. Lady didnt come back to refill my sparkling water glass. Atmosphere and music selection was ok. Food was ok. I had the filet mignon and it was ok. Didnt have too much flavor. Overall nothing stands out that makes me want to come back. Good spot to get out of the cold weather if nothing else is available.
Nice location, but food was rather medium and completely overpriced, and staff was rude.
Looks like it would be pretty and lush .. But it's actually dusty and gross. Service was nonexistent
Great food !

Our family went to Acqua Santa for a wedding reception. The food was superb; the filet mignon was the best I have ever had. The professional and friendly wait staff were constantly concerned about the guests. Acqua Santa had a relaxed atmosphere which allowed the bride and groom to be comfortable to celebrate easily with their family and friends. The physical design of the restaurant facilitated and accomodated a variety of activities for a wedding reception, i.e. dancing, photo booth, mingling, and traditional wedding activities. Great memories and I would recommend Acqua Santa.

Food was delicious! Really enjoyed my pizza with the cheese just melting off and the calamari I had was the perfect amount of crispy with a great lemon zest. Sorbet was pretty good too. Only issue I had was with the service. While the girls working there were friendly enough, they would forget things and take forever to bring things. There were only 3 other tables in the restaurant. It wasn't busy. 3 minutes after we got out calamari appetizer our pizza came out. Pretty bad timing. I only forgot about the issues at the time because the food was so good. But wouldn't want to go back especially when it's busy.

Took my girlfriend here for a nice romantic dinner not knowing how the food would be other than reviews on yelp and I'm so glad we came. The service was friendly and werent on top of us ever 5 seconds which was nice as we were able to enjoy our date. The food was amazing, pizza was fresh and crispy, the bread with mozz and caper sauce was the best thing i have every had, and our main course was just as good. The Beet Gnocchi was to die for and the shrimp scampi was very good. Prices were very reasonable and I cant wait to come again. Def go to this spot as you will not be dissipointed.

When we walked into the restaurant, it felt as though we walked into a vineyard in Italy. It was an unique dining room. There were several specials. We ordered the calamari in lemon olive oil. It did not come with marinara sauce. No grated cheese. Then I ordered the shrimp in brandy sauce. My friend ordered homemade pasta with bolognese (meat) sauce. Excellent. The foccia was delicious. The tirimasu is delicious. Homemade. The waitstaff are extremely friendly and helpful. Great place to eat. And sit with friends and family with a glass of wine. The wine was fresh and crispy. Moderate to expensive.

Acqua Santa hosted my sisters baby shower in June. They did an amazing job! The food was delicious, the restaurant beautiful and the staff amazing! Mario is friendly and accommodating. There was nothing he couldn't do! He is a sweet wholesome man. When talking to him you feel as if you are his family. the best place!
Aqua Santa has the best Italian cuisine and their Calzone of Season is my personal favorite where the mozzarella stuffed fresh tomatoes are simply heavenly. It is one place you should not miss out.
Excellent romantic restaurant, garden is charming and dishes are rustic southern italian, beautiful pizzas from the actual wood burning oven

Dreamy backyard seating with antique chairs, beautiful plants, a fountain and twinkly white lights. Service was great (French and Italian servers made for an authentic Brooklyn/European experience). Food was very decent. Pasta, Pizza, Fish, Salads. Straight forward menu, desserts looked great. A little on the pricey side, but if you're seated in the back very worth it!
Cozy outdoor seating. Great food and wine. Charming service. Good for a date.
Love the garden. Such perfect place for brunch
